intro: Leucopogon nervosus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight whitish or silver-colored underside, giving it a distinctive appearance. Leucopogon nervosus is often found in wetland habitats such as bogs and pine flatwoods.
